VerticalStablilizer¶

class components.liftingsurfaces.verticalstab.VerticalStabilizer(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

This class will size the VT according to statistical VT volume coefficients and generate it using the LiftingSurface primitive. Also, the bounding box is made for the section of the VTP within the fuselage, which is used to size the fuselage frames.

Returns:

ParaPy Geometry of the VT
Parameters:
  • wing_planform_area (float) – This is the wing planfrom area in [m^2]
  • wing_mac_length (float) – This is the MAC length of the wing in SI meters
  • wing_semi_span (float) – This is the semispan of the wing in SI meters
  • lvc (float) – This is non-dimensionalized vertical tail arm for the conventional plane.
  • lvc_canard (float) – This is non-dimensionalized vertical tail arm for the canard plane. Note for the canard the VTP is is much closer to the main wing!
  • configuration (float) – This is a switch to determine the configuration.
  • aspect_ratio (float) – This is the assumed Aspect Ratio of the VT Surface.
  • is_half (bool) – This overwrites the is_half parameter from the class LiftingSurface stating that the entire surface area is covering one VT.
  • taper (float) – This is the required Taper Ratio of the VT Surface.
  • twist (float) – This is the required Twist Angle of the Tip Airfoil w.r.t the Root Airfoil in degrees.
  • offset (float or NoneType) – This is the offset in the flow direction of the tip W.R.T. the root Leading Edge.
  • fuse_width_factor (float) – This is the assumed factor of the semispan which the fuselage extends over the VT semispan
  • airfoil_type (str) – This is the name of the folder within the ‘airfoils’ folder. There are three options ‘cambered’, ‘reflexed’ and ‘symmetric’.
  • airfoil_choice (str) – This is the filename of the requested airfoil.
  • ply_number (int) – Changes the number of ply’s of carbon fiber pre-preg.
airfoil_choice¶

This is the airfoil filename for the VT. This must contain the correct filename name of the airfoil.

airfoil_type¶

This is the airfoil type for the VT. This must contain the correct folder name to the airfoils.

aspect_ratio¶

Below is the assumed VT aspect ratio.

center_of_gravity[source]¶

This finds the COG for the VT.

Returns:ParaPy Point
Return type:Point
component_type[source]¶

This attribute names the component ‘vt’ for horizontal stabilizer.

Returns:Name of VT
Return type:str
configuration¶

Below is a switch to determine the configuration.

external_shape[source]¶

This defines the external shape for the ExternalBody class in definitions.

Returns:VTP External Geometry
Return type:ScaledShape
fuse_width_factor¶

Below is the assumed factor relating the part of the VT covered by fuse to semispan.

get_vtfuse_bounds[source]¶

This attribute is obtaining (the dimensions of) a bounded box at a fuselage width factor of the semispan which will be used to size the fuselage frames. These frames drive the shape of the fuselage.

Returns:VTP fuselage section bounding box
Return type:bbox
internal_shape[source]¶

This is creating the bounded box at a fuselage width factor of the semispan which will be used to size the fuselage frames. These frames drive the shape of the fuselage.

Returns:VTP fuselage section bounding box
Return type:Box
is_half¶

This overwrites the is_half parameter from the class LiftingSurface.

lvc¶

Below is non-dimensionalized vertical tail arm for the conventional plane.

offset¶

Below is the chosen trailing edge offset.

planform_area[source]¶

This attribute calculates the total tail surface area based on the estimated VT volume coefficient.

Returns:VT planform area
Return type:float
ply_number¶

Changes the number of ply’s of carbon fiber http://www.ijera.com/papers/Vol4_issue5/Version%202/J45025355.pdf

solid[source]¶

This rotates the entire VT solid LiftingSurface instantiation by 90 deg.

Returns:ParaPy rotated lofted solid wing geometry.
Return type:RotatedShape
taper¶

Below is the assumed VT taper ratio.

twist¶

This is the wing twist for the VT.

v_v[source]¶

This attribute estimates the VTP volume coefficient from statistical agricultural conventional aircraft data.

Returns:Estimated VT volume coefficient
Return type:float
v_v_canard[source]¶

This attribute calculates the tail volume coefficient for a canard. This is done by rewriting the equation for a conventional VT volume coefficient for S_v/S, equating it to the same equation of the canard. The canard tail volume is thus a reduced tail volume coefficient (with the canard having a smaller tail arm).

Returns:Estimated Canard VT volume coefficient
Return type:float
vtright_cut_plane[source]¶

This makes a plane at the VTP span location where the fuselage is to end.

Returns:VTP cut Plane ParaPy Geometry
Return type:Plane
vtwing_cut_loc[source]¶

This calculates the spanwise distance of the cut, inside of which, the VTP is inside the fuselage.

Returns:VTP length within the fuselage
Return type:float
wing_mac_length¶

Below is the MAC length of the wing.

wing_planform_area¶

Below is the required TOTAL wing area of the main wings.

wing_semi_span¶

Below is the semispan of the wing.
